[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Deserialize] [Size bomb] Can an attacker craft a small serialized payload that expands to huge memory consumption during deserialization, causing OOM and node crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Serialize] [Enum discriminant] Is the MultisigTransactionPayload enum discriminant stable across protocol versions, or can upgrades cause deserialization of old transactions to fail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Deserialize] [Recursive payload] Can a maliciously crafted serialized MultisigTransactionPayload contain recursive or cyclic references causing infinite loops during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Hash] [Hash collision] Can two different Multisig transactions produce the same hash value, allowing transaction replacement attacks or double-execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Hash] [Hash stability] Is the Hash implementation stable across different platforms and Rust versions to ensure consensus nodes agree on transaction ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Hash] [Option hashing] Does None vs Some(payload) hash differently enough to prevent second pre-image attacks where attacker finds payload that collides with None? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Hash] [Address hashing] Is multisig_address hashed in big-endian/little-endian consistently to prevent different nodes computing different hashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Eq/PartialEq] [Equality bypass] Can an attacker craft two Multisig instances that are semantically different but compare as equal, allowing transaction deduplication bypass? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Eq/PartialEq] [Float comparison] If future payload types include floating point, will NaN handling break equality invariants and cause consensus divergence? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Eq/PartialEq] [None equality] Does None == None for transaction_payload, and can this be exploited to make unapproved transactions appear approved? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Clone] [Deep vs shallow] Does Clone create deep copies of nested EntryFunction data, or can attacker modify shared references affecting multiple transaction instances? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Clone] [Clone cost] Is cloning a Multisig with large payload proportional to payload size, or can attacker submit huge payloads causing DoS during clone operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Trait: Clone] [Reference counting] If EntryFunction uses Arc internally, does cloning increment reference counts correctly to prevent use-after-free? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Validation bypass] Does the VM validate that Multisig transactions have sufficient approvals before calling as_transaction_executable(), or can this check be skipped? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Prologue execution] During multisig prologue execution, is there validation that the transaction signer matches the multisig_address, or can any account trigger execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Payload hash verification] When transaction_payload is Some, does the VM verify it matches the on-chain stored hash, or is the provided payload blindly executed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Signature threshold] Can an attacker submit a Multisig transaction that executes with fewer signatures than the account's threshold by exploiting None payload handling? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Sequence number] Does a multisig transaction consume sequence numbers from the multisig account or the transaction sender, and can this be exploited for replay attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Gas payment] Who pays gas for multisig transactions - the sender or multisig account - and can attacker drain multisig funds through repeated transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Entry function restrictions] Are there restrictions on which entry functions can be called via Multisig, or can attacker call privileged system functions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Type argument injection] Can attacker inject malicious type arguments in the EntryFunction that bypass Move type safety or access restricted resources? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Argument deserialization] Are EntryFunction arguments properly validated during deserialization, or can malformed arguments cause VM crashes or undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Integration] [Module loading] When executing the EntryFunction, does the VM properly load and verify the target module, or can attacker reference malicious modules? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Concurrency] [Parallel execution] During Block-STM parallel execution, can two multisig transactions from the same account execute concurrently, causing double-spending or nonce conflicts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Concurrency] [Approval race] Can a multisig owner submit a transaction while approvals are being added/removed, causing execution with stale approval state? (High)
